page.title: 18Kennethmont School Part 1.
page.content: The school consists of two buildings, one housing two classrooms and the other containing two classrooms, a large hall, a kitchen, an office, toilets, storecupboards and the boiler room for the heating. The school population at present is 48 pupils all between the ages of 5 and 13 years. The pupils are split into 3 class groups: the younger pupils in Primary 1, Primary 2 and Primary 3 are all together in one classroom; the pupils of Primaries 4 and 5 are together in another classroom and the senior pupils of Primaries 6 and 7 are together in a third room. The fourth classroom is used for Art lessons, Home-Economics and occasionally by some of the visitors to the school. The hall is used as a dining room and all the pupils stay for lunch which is prepared in the school kitchen.{CONT.{
